column4: I have lost my audio after a bios upgrade. I have checked the controller is enabled in the BIOS settings, disable and renabled, but no jou with that, or reverting back to old version. My sound card (internal intel HDA) is shown in the lspci output, and on aplay -l. How should I go about troubleshooting this?
what is the output of: wget -O alsa-info.sh http://www.alsa-project.org/alsa-info.sh; chmod +x ./alsa-info.sh; ./alsa-info.sh
I hear a crack from the speakers (which I have tested on another box) when the ubuntu start up chime should play, then nothing
paste from ActionParsnip 's command: http://paste.ubuntu.com/758861/
if you run:  killall pulseaudio; rm -r ~/.pulse*     then wait a few seconds then try some sound apps, does it work ok?
ActionParsnip; no, still no output
and if you run:  alsamixer    are all levels cranked and unmuted?
All except front mic, yes
what is the output of:  lsb_release -sc
oneiric
try: http://pastebin.com/Ny8ejyhH
Done. I am told all are newest version, "0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded."
yeah sorry, run: sudo apt-get --reinstall install linux-sound-base alsa-base alsa-utils libasound2
Hmm, last lineof output is "E: Internal Error, No file name for libasound2"
then remove that package...
from the command
Ok, done.  Still no sound. Would you expect me to have the libasound2 package installed, normally?
not sure its on the sound troubleshooting page
have you tried setting BIOS to failsafe defaults then reconfiguring from there
Yes, I have taken the CMOS battery out as well, hopeing It might reset some setting, but no joy.
The only option I have which is anything to do with the sound is under southbridge configuration, "sound controller" options either "enable" or "disable". nothing else as far as I can see
i tried disabling, rebooting, renenabling to no effect
no irq conflicts?
could look in: dmesg | less    to see what's going on
